area_name: Piedra River - East Side: Sheep Creek Trail/Piedra Hot Springs

content.description: Stand start off the two pockets/edges, and climb up the steep, slab face. Use a cool, two-finger, sloper gaston.
content.protection: It has a nice landing, but one small pad would be ideal due to the long approach/exit.
content.location: It is 3/4 of the way to the hot springs on the right side of the main trail.

content.description:
Sit start the left-leaning arete to the right of the

Slab

problem.
content.protection: A small pad. There is a tree directly behind you to keep your head in the game while you're climbing.
content.location: It is 3/4 of the way to the hot springs on the right side of the main trail.

content.description: This is the downclimb behind the Trailside Boulder. It's a slab and great for anyone tagging along new to bouldering.
content.location: It is behind the boulder opposite the trail, 3/4 of the way to the hot springs on the right side of the main trail.

content.description:
Sit start low and left of

Slab

. Mantle the first sloping ledge, face the lip, and mantle up again.
content.protection: A small pad if you can.
content.location: It is 3/4 of the way to the hot springs on the right side of the main trail.

pathTokens: Piedra River - East Side: Sheep Creek Trail/Piedra Hot Springs
